column1:
SMTP Pro Email Extension
Configure your SMTP connection below. If you have any questions or would like any help please visit magesmtppro.com.
column2:
SMTP Pro Email Extension
Configure your SMTP connection below. If you have any questions or would like any help please visit magesmtppro.com.

column1: Input your Google Apps or Gmail username and password here. For configuration recommendations please see the guide at magesmtppro.com
column2: Input your Google Apps or Gmail username and password here. For configuration recommendations please see the guide at magesmtppro.com

column1: Input your SendGrid username and password here. For more information visit SendGrid
column2: Input your SendGrid username and password here. For more information visit SendGrid

column1: Amazon SES support in SMTP Pro is limited and best suited to development and testing purposes. For a full integration with region selection, error/bounce logging and send statistics please see the premium extension: MageSend
column2: Amazon SES support in SMTP Pro is limited and best suited to development and testing purposes. For a full integration with region selection, error/bounce logging and send statistics please see the premium extension: MageSend

column1: Custom SMTP servers can be configured in this section. For more information about these configuration options and troubleshooting advice please see magesmtppro.com
column2: Custom SMTP servers can be configured in this section. For more information about these configuration options and troubleshooting advice please see magesmtppro.com

column1: Please only use these settings if you are a software developer or server admin.
column2: Please only use these settings if you are a software developer or server admin.

column1: This will log all outbound emails. View from System->Tools->SMTPPro - Email Log.
column2: This will log all outbound emails. View from System->Tools->SMTPPro - Email Log.

column1: If this is set to yes, old entries will be deleted from email log. Cron is required and log cleaning must be enabled in system/log/enabled for this to work.
column2: If this is set to yes, old entries will be deleted from email log. Cron is required and log cleaning must be enabled in system/log/enabled for this to work.

column1: If yes, a log file will be written with debug information.
column2: If yes, a log file will be written with debug information.
